result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan D. Stevens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

IT IS ORDERED: This case is transferred to Eau Claire County Circuit Court Branch 2 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court Program. The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.
